1 CERA_CHECK_1 - What types of ceramic or glass products are made where you work?
CERA_1G Engineered, agglomerated or reconstituted stone, also known as quartz conglomerate or quartzites, Caesarstone, Silestone, Technistone (7)
1F1 CERA_RADIO_1F1 - In the last working week, did you make lead cutting glass?
1F1A1 CERA_RADIO_1F1A1 - In the last working week, did you mix red lead into sand when making lead cutting glass?
If 1 = CERA_1G Engineered, agglomerated or reconstituted stone, also known as quartz conglomerate or quartzites, Caesarstone, Silestone, Technistone
RADIO_1G1_1 - In the last working week, did you cut, drill, grind, polish or work with concrete, stone, artificial stone, slate, ceramic tiles or bricks?
RADIO_1G1_1A1 - Which of the following materials did you work with?
aCTS_1A1A Concrete, natural stone, or bricks (1)
aCTS_1A1B Artificial stone such as engineered, agglomerated or reconstituted stone, also known as quartz conglomerate or quartzites, Caesarstone, Silestone, Technistone (2)
RADIO_1G1_1A2 - In the last working week, did you use water suppression all the time when you were working on these materials?
RADIO_1G1_1A3 - In the last working week, did you use on tool ventilation or dust collection when you worked with these materials?
RADIO_1G1_1A4 - In the last working week, did you always work in the open air when you worked with these materials?
RADIO_1G1_1A5 - In the last working week, did you use a filtering or air-supplied respirator when you worked with these materials (including if you were working in the open air)?
2 CERA_RADIO_2 - In the last working week, did you mix or handle (e.g., crushing, sizing, transferring) any raw materials in dry form?
2A1 CERA_CHECK_2A1 - What types of measures were used to reduce the amount of dust in your work area in the last working week?
CERA_2A1B Water atomisers or water dust suppression (2)
CERA_2A1C Respiratory protective equipment (e.g., FFP mask) (3)
3 CERA_RADIO_3 - In the last working week, did you do any dry fettling?

CERA_3A2B Water atomisers or water dust suppression (2)

4A2 CERA_RADIO_4A2 - In the last working week, did you handle or come in contact with pigments that contained cobalt?
5 CERA_RADIO_5 - In the last working week, did you work in the forming or moulding area?
5A1 CERA_CHECK_5A1 - What type of forming techniques did you use?
CERA_5A1A Dry pressing, such as uniaxial pressing or isostatic pressing (1)
CERA_5A1B Stiff plastic forming, such as extrusion or injection moulding (2)
CERA_5A1C Soft plastic forming by machine, such as jiggering, jollying, or ram pressing (3)
CERA_5A1D Soft plastic forming by hand, such as throwing or wheel turning (4)
CERA_5A1E Casting, such as slip casting or pressure casting (5)

RADIO_6_1A2 - In the last working week, did you apply the glaze by spraying?
RADIO_6_1A2A1 - Did you use an extracted booth when spraying glazes in the last working week?
7 CERA_RADIO_7 - In the last working week, did you use paints, varnishes, stains or sealants, or prepare items for painting (i.e., strip or sand items)?
RADIO_7A1_1 - In the last working week, did you sand or polish items?
CHECK_7A1_1A1 - In the last working week, did you sand any of the following items?
aSAN_1A1A Chipboard, MDF, plywood, or pressed wood (1)
aSAN_1A1E Artificial stone such as engineered, agglomerated or reconstituted stone, also known as quartz conglomerate or quartzites, Caesarstone, Silestone, Technistone (5)
RADIO_7A1_1A1D1 - In the last working week, did you sand painted metal?
RADIO_7A1_1A2 - Was there a ventilation system that removed dust or fume from where you worked in the last working week (local exhaust ventilation or on-tool extraction)?
CHECK_7A1_1A3 - In the last working week, which of the following did you use to sand or polish the items?
aSAN_1A3A A power sander or polisher (1)
aSAN_1A3B A hand sander or polisher (2)
RADIO_7A1_1A4 - In the last working week, did you use respiratory protection while sanding or polishing items?
CHECK_7A1_1A4A1 - What types of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use?
aSAN_1A4A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge (1)
aSAN_1A4A1C Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus) (3)
aSAN_1A4A1D A filtering face piece mask or dust mask (called an FFP) (4)
RADIO_7A2_1 - In the last working week, did you strip paint from existing surfaces?
RADIO_7A2_1A1 - In the last working week, did you use sanding, blasting or grinding methods to strip paint from existing surfaces?
CHECK_7A2_1A1A1 - Which of the following measures did you use while sanding, blasting or grinding?
aSTP_1A1A1A On-tool extraction to remove dust (1)
aSTP_1A1A1B Wet sanding, blasting or grinding (2)
RADIO_7A2_1A2 - In the last working week, did you strip lead-based paint?
RADIO_7A2_1A3 - In the last working week, did you strip old paint which was likely to have been applied before 2001?
RADIO_7A2_1A4 - In the last working week, where did you strip paint?
CHECK_7A2_1A4A1 - How was the area ventilated?
aSTP_1A4A1A By local exhaust ventilation which captured the vapour, dust, fume at the emission point (1)
aSTP_1A4A1B By on-tool extraction to remove dust and fumes away from your face (2)
aSTP_1A4A1C By a general ventilation system (3)
aSTP_1A4A1D By fans in the window or doorway (4)
aSTP_1A4A1E By open doors or windows (5)
aSTP_1A4A1F No ventilation was applied to the area (6)

aSTP_1A5A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge (1)
